intro: Acinodendron setulosum, commonly known as the rough-leaved acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, often hairy leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds.
